topic.title: Getting rid of facebook
topic.body:
Getting rid of facebook and pretty much all clearnet sites, with a few exceptions. I think i'll stick to perusing some clearnet imageboards; bunkerchan,xyz, 7chan, maybe 420chan, but, I think I am starting to use less and less of the clearnet. To many normies and to much trouble.

I mainly use sites through tor, i2p, Zeronet and freenet these days.

May you join me on the otherside; Live long and prosper, anon.

1566177396_18oN5jkSiB1SLb4Jywb4ZnKiwXqtQ.body:
What are you running on? Give me a little more information.
It sounds like you're having connection issues with tor. Are you able to connect to any hidden services?

1566171789_1aaGBN84Cc8VE7iocUxPXiRVhx9qS.body:

1566357785_1GQMHdkj67rAzy1uMbq5Smvhg9o4Y.body: I'm ok, man. I inherited some money from a relative who passed away. I finally got some nice clothing and furniture, lol. But it's bitter sweet, still. Wbu op?

1566241934_13ifSHXbs2RtyHF4qkn4GrJ3krWEA.body:
> [ratsmack](#comment_22_16BaY5JLzzA8TPe4jzXtp3CfZi3Qks2SU5): It's funny how Security Concerned people willingly trust a VPN service: https://gist.github.com/joepie91/5a9909939e6ce7d09e29 [...]

Wow, not an argument.

> [ratsmack](#comment_22_16BaY5JLzzA8TPe4jzXtp3CfZi3Qks2SU5): It's funny how Security Concerned people willingly trust a VPN service: https://gist.github.com/joepie91/5a9909939e6ce7d09e29 [...]

Wow, not an argument.

> [aspidochelone](#comment_108_1PPUrYcZ1E1rGkkE6PH18Qi43LRsKABo1Z): Don't ignore risks outside the transmission channel.  If something you're accessing is more serious than government censors wanting to block it to virtue signal -- say, if you had Epstein's financial client list and holdings -- then if you read that file it is on your computer.  And, well, in the past week I saw Avast twice decide to up and transfer pieces of ZeroNet into the "virus chest" on account of "IDP:Generic" unspecified behavior, and that (like all anti-virus programs) has terms and conditions that inspire less than zero confidence.  So what do you think would happen if you had a file that somebody with a lot of cash or power was really, REALLY looking for?  (Yeah, you could turn off the virus checker, except the one in Windows, and Windows has terms and conditions that look like they might have been written by the same people). [...]

Using windows is about as insecure as you can get.

> [gitcenter](#comment_632_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): Eh, why?

Because you are just turning things around on him; you aren't actually addressing his question. Javascript is notoriously insecure.

> [gitcenter](#comment_633_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): Sure, but: [...]

Ok, my bad.
And that still doesn't matter because OP using a VPN is irreverent to the actual security of Zeronet.

1570980089_1PGTHAmvu7K2PM7qqfoKyWv69aJsA.body:
> [harpyproductions](#comment_1_13kCqkdmy1yvF6mafYjGwnGhvJZnDiHJhj): do you think the feds wont know the difference from who actually browses that page and people who just passing by and get away as soon as they notice what CP actually stands for? i already got in at least 2 cp pages without knowing what it was about only 1 had cp in the name one of them at 08chan.bit. i run away as soon as i noticed and so far i have no problems with authorities

Do you think they will care? If you have it on your drive then they have grounds to prosecute you. The state just cares about making money. Practice good opsec. Practice full disk encryption. Wipe constantly; programs like bleach bit are your friend (Ir just straight up microwaving old memory units and getting new ones constantly.) and, yeah, like the other dude said. Just black list anything that looks even remotely suspicious.

> [harpyproductions](#comment_2_13kCqkdmy1yvF6mafYjGwnGhvJZnDiHJhj): i forgot to mention that i imediately deleted from my driver later. so what i was saying is that he can enter the page just to check if it is CP then he leave and if he deletes it , it is all ok.

> [harpyproductions](#comment_3_13kCqkdmy1yvF6mafYjGwnGhvJZnDiHJhj): also he probably has to never come back again. this will tell the feds that you came there by mistake and want nothing to do with it. they have more things to do than to investigate a guy who probably already deleted all the files and even overwrite the free space just to be sure

Bro, read my lips, they don't give a singular fuck about you. The state is the coldest of all cold monsters.
It has its maxim that it must follow to the T at all costs.
The law is the law; owning child pornography is illegal. Weather you ment to jack off to it or not.
That is justice. 

Maybe Zeronet isn't the place for you if you think you are at risk right now for stumbling on CP.
Play with fire and you will get burned.

A lot of very smart people, not a lot of common ground.

Dread pirate got caught because he was lazy and niave. Not because of the failures of tor.
